item.title: How To: Shrink WSL Disk Size on Windows 10
item.description: I recently downloaded and processed some large files on Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) on Windows 10. Once I was done with the files, I deleted them from my Ubuntu installation, but the VHD file was still taking up the same amount of space as it was before I deleted the files. It turns out that Windows and WSL does not automatically shrink the VHD file if you delete files - it just automatically expands it as you use more space in WSL. How to shrink the VHD file Locate the VHD file in your user directory of Windows.
